abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Finance Development Structural
            Adjustment Loan Project for Mexico has a satisfactory
            outcome, is highly likely to be sustainable, and has a high
            institutional development impact. Bank performance was
            satisfactory and borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Among the major lessons learned, these were cited as
            important for project success: a stable political
            environment, strong ownership by the government and
            attention of the finance ministry, a suitable and
            country-specific time-frame for implementing
            institution-building activities and technical assistance
            components, an appropriate amount of Bank supervision and
            monitoring, making training a priority, a system of
            incentives to retain skilled staff, an assessment of the
            country's readiness to receive and grow in technical
            know-how, factoring in a "post implementation
            supervision" time to ensure that post-deployment
            problems arising in new systems can be resolved, and for
            turnkey projects, paying close attention to drafting
            detailed Terms of Reference for consultants to ensure the
            participation of specific experts.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Fiscal Technical
            Assistance Project are 1) to increase the efficiency and
            accountability of the Mongolian government; and 2) to set up
            a more effective, nondistortive system of government revenue
            mobilization. There are two components. The first, the
            government financial management component, finances advisory
            services and training in government accounting, treasury
            debt and cash management, auditing, management skills and
            related disciplines. Based on a defined needs assessment,
            the project assists in implementing an improved core
            government financial management system. The project provides
            technical assistance and later, computer equipment and
            software, office equipment, and training facilities to
            assist the authorities in designing, developing, testing,
            and implementing processes, procedures, systems, and related
            regulations. The second component introduces the VAT
            (value-added tax) on goods and services by finalizing
            implementing regulations, formulating and implementing a
            publicity campaign, developing a detailed plan to inform
            taxpayers, formulating, printing, and distributing guideline
            materials; tax administration operations including forming
            and implementing detailed plans for policy interpretation,
            taxpayer registration, tax accounting and reporting, tax
            auditing, and forming and developing an information exchange
            between tax administration and customs.
